In Hinduism, there are two main religious groups: Hindus and Buddhists. Both groups have their own beliefs, practices, and traditions. Hindus worship many gods and goddesses, while Buddhists worship Buddha. These two religions have a long history of coexistence in India, and they share many similarities in their beliefs and practices.

In the context of the question, it is likely that the Buddhistic person and the Hindu person grew up in households that practiced similar religious traditions.
